alert.note: Alert for Alamance (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 8:26AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Alamance County through 915 AM EST... At 826 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Siler City, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Graham, Mebane, Elon, Gibsonville, Haw River, Swepsonville, Alamance, Snow Camp and Lake Burlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EST for central North Carolina.
